ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Hormone saliva sample tube cap color:
Notes: 1=Pink/Purple (female) ; 2=Blue (male) ; 3=Participant unable to complete ; 4=Participant/Parent refused ; 6=Institution not authorized to collect samples due to COVID ; 7=Staff discomfort due to COVID ; 8=Exceed 15min of < 6ft distance from youth (COVID) ; 9=Not approved by ABCD for collection ; 5=Not collected (other)

ElementDescription: What time did you wake up today?
Have you had any caffeine in the last 12 hours?

How many drinks (mg) did you have?

 RA: Please use the following link to determine total miligrams per serving size and open the link in new window: caffeine chart
Notes: record drinks as total miligrams (use 'caffeine chart' link)

ElementDescription: In the last 12 hours, did you exercise vigorously (sweating, breathing hard) for at least 20 minutes?
For how long did you exercise?
Notes: record time as minutes, minimum is approx 20 minutes

ElementDescription: Hormone saliva sample time collection started?
Hormone saliva sample time collection finished?
Hormone saliva barcode:
Notes: Use the Barcode Scanner - do NOT type barcode label

ElementDescription: Hormone sample storage temperature:
Notes: 1 = -20 C freezer; 2 = -80 C freezer | Indicate temperature of 3-month storage freezer here.

ElementDescription: Time sample moved to freezer:
Note any concerns about sample (all that apply) (1, None)
Note any concerns about sample (all that apply) ( 2, Contaminated)
Note any concerns about sample (all that apply) ( 3, Discoloration)
Note any concerns about sample (all that apply) ( 4, Excessive bubbles)
Note any concerns about sample (all that apply) ( 5, Very little saliva provided)
Note any concerns about sample (all that apply) ( 6, Other)
